item.title: 受政策前景影响，澳元兑新西兰元汇率测试年内高点
item.description: 由于决策者对利率前景的看法不一，投资者认为澳元兑新西兰元将测试今年的高点。【原文：Investors see the Australian dollar testing this year’s high against its New Zealand counterpart as policymakers diverge on the interest-rate outlook.】

item.title: 法国政府为削减开支瞄准旷工问题
item.description: 法国政府计划在明年的预算中削减 50 亿欧元（54 亿美元）的开支，作为一系列措施的一部分，法国政府计划打击公务员缺勤现象并减少发展援助。【原文：The French government plans to crack down on absenteeism in the civil service and reduce development aid as part of a series of measures aimed at delivering €5 billion ($5.4 billion) of spending cuts in next year’s budget.】

item.title: 以色列悄悄夸耀攻打伊朗的战略收益
item.description: 在出动 100 多架战斗机袭击伊朗之后，以色列政府正试图在一条微妙的界线上行走：以色列官员认为这次袭击造成了重大的战略损害，但又希望伊朗继续将其视为不值得回应的攻击。【原文：After sending more than 100 fighter planes to attack Iran, the Israeli government is seeking to walk a fine line: Officials there believe the attack did significant strategic damage but want to allow Iran to continue dismissing it as unworthy of response.】

item.title: 省长表示，安大略省将把汽油税减免政策延长至 2025 年 6 月
item.description: 安大略省省长道格-福特（Doug Ford）在周日的新闻发布会上表示，安大略省计划将汽油和柴油税的临时减税措施延长至明年 6 月。【原文：Ontario plans to extend a temporary cut to gasoline and diesel taxes to next June, Premier Doug Ford said at a news conference Sunday.】

item.title: 受大跌打击的债券市场即将迎来 10 天考验
item.description: 美国债券市场已经遭受了六个月来最严重的抛售，现在正进入关键的两周，这两周很可能将决定今年余下时间的走势。【原文：The US bond market, already stung by the worst selloff in six months, now heads into a crucial two-week stretch that will likely chart its course for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 盈利增长放缓，大型科技股失去光环
item.description: 随着科技巨头们准备在本周公布财报，利润增长放缓正在消除股市中的一些不稳定性。它们能否扭转这一趋势，将在很大程度上决定股市能否继续反弹。【原文：Slowing profit growth is removing some of the invincibility surrounding the stock market’s technology giants as they prepare to report earnings this week. Whether they can reverse that trend will go a long way to determining if the rally in equities can keep going.】

item.title: 意大利称私家侦探入侵国家安全数据
item.description: 米兰检察官说，警方逮捕了一系列与私家侦探有关的人，这些私家侦探向客户提供从国家安全数据库中窃取的信息。【原文：Prosecutors in Milan said police made a series of arrests linked to private investigators who offered clients information stolen from national security databases.】

item.title: 金融市场动荡加剧，全球基金将目光投向印度
item.description: 印度正在成为投资者寻求相对避开美国大选带来的金融动荡的目的地。【原文：India is shaping up to be a destination for investors seeking a relative shelter from financial volatility linked to the US election.】

item.title: 人权组织称无国界记者组织民兵在苏丹的袭击造成 120 多人死亡
item.description: 一个人权组织称，在苏丹有120多人被快速支援部队的民兵杀害，联合国谴责在这个东非国家发生的滥杀平民和性暴力行为。【原文：More than 120 people were killed by militiamen belonging to the Rapid Support Forces in Sudan, a rights group said, as the United Nations decried indiscriminate shootings of civilians and acts of sexual violence in the East African nation.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司风险投资部门拨款 1 亿美元用于人工智能投资
item.description: 沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）的风险投资部门已拨出 1 亿美元，用于投资人工智能初创企业，以加速推动沙特阿拉伯成为全球人工智能领域更具竞争力的力量。【原文：Saudi Aramco’s venture arm has earmarked $100 million to invest in artificial intelligence startups as it looks to accelerate Saudi Arabia’s push to become a more competitive force in global AI.】

item.title: 卡多佐预计尼日利亚汇款将增至 120 亿美元：今日报
item.description: 据《今日报》报道，尼日利亚央行行长奥拉耶米-卡多佐（Olayemi Cardoso）表示，尼日利亚有信心每月从海外公民那里吸引 10 亿美元的汇款。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank Governor Olayemi Cardoso said the country was confident of attracting $1 billion in monthly remittances from overseas citizens, according to Thisday newspaper.】

item.title: 丰田和现代汽车董事长联手举办罕见赛车活动
item.description: 亚洲最大的两家汽车制造商的董事长罕见地联合公开亮相，展示各自公司的高性能汽车，凸显了竞争对手携手应对电气化的趋势。【原文：The chairmen of Asia’s two largest automakers made a rare joint public appearance at an event to showcase their companies’ high-performance vehicles, underscoring the trend of rivals joining hands in the face of electrification.】

item.title: 中国警告美国将对最新售台武器事件作出回应
item.description: 中国表示，在美国向台湾出售最新武器后，中国已向美国提出外交控诉，并保留报复的权利。【原文：China said it filed a diplomatic complaint with the US and reserved the right to retaliate after the latest American weapons sales to Taiwan, escalating tensions in their dispute over the archipelago.】

item.title: 中国工业利润跌幅扩大，通货紧缩造成影响
item.description: 由于通货紧缩压力削弱了企业财务实力，9 月份中国工业企业利润下降速度比上月加快。【原文：Profits at China’s industrial firms in September declined at a faster pace than a month earlier, as deflationary pressures sap the strength of corporate finances.】

item.title: 美联储政策会议前的 GDP、受暴风雨影响的就业数据将成为议题
item.description: 在美联储官员聚首思考适当降息节奏的一周前，三份备受瞩目的报告将显示美国经济的潜在韧性以及就业增长的暂时性停滞。【原文：A week before Federal Reserve officials gather to reflect on the appropriate tempo of interest-rates cuts, three high-profile reports are set to show underlying resilience in the US economy and a temporary hiccup in job growth.】

item.title: 信息称，谷歌将预览可控制计算机的人工智能
item.description: 据《信息报》报道，Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司计划预览人工智能技术，该技术可以接管网络浏览器，完成研究和购物等任务。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google plans to preview artificial intelligence technology that takes over a web browser to complete tasks such as research and shopping, the Information reported.】

item.title: 债券交易狂热有可能给市场制造者带来虚假的安全感
item.description: 从表面上看，公司债券市场从未像现在这样稳定和流动。在美国，9 月份的市场交易量创下了有史以来最繁忙的一个月。【原文：On the surface, the corporate bond market has never looked more stable and liquid. In the US, the market recorded its busiest month ever for trading volume in September.】

item.title: 投资者对养老金改革持谨慎态度，乌拉圭进入投票阶段
item.description: 乌拉圭选民将于周日在一场总统竞选中投票，而这场竞选正被一场有争议的养老金改革所掩盖。【原文：Voters in Uruguay are set to cast their ballots Sunday in a presidential race that’s being overshadowed by a contentious pension overhaul.】

item.title: 纳格尔说：俄罗斯要求国际合作是个笑话
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）说，鉴于俄罗斯在 2022 年入侵乌克兰，俄罗斯在 20 国集团中提出的各国需要合作的要求是一种嘲弄，并将德国的部分经济问题归咎于战争。【原文：Russian demands in the Group of 20 that countries need to cooperate are a mockery given its invasion of Ukraine in 2022, Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said, blaming part of Germany’s economic troubles on the war.】

item.title: 随着 S&P 的反弹超越科技领域，利润增长仍遥遥无期
item.description: 尽管大型科技公司不景气，但看似势不可挡的美国股市仍在继续上涨，因为涨势已经分散到房地产等行业，而这些行业在今年上半年都举步维艰。【原文：The seemingly unstoppable US stock market continues to rise despite Big Tech’s slump, as the gains diversify to industry groups like real estate that struggled through the first half of the year.】

item.title: 以色列对伊朗的有限攻击可能有助于达成地区协议
item.description: 周六早些时候，以色列在与华盛顿协调后对伊朗发动了攻击，攻击范围仅限于导弹和防空基地，这次攻击比许多人预期的更为克制，可能有助于归还人质和限制黎巴嫩和加沙战事的外交努力。【原文：Israel’s assault on Iran early Saturday, coordinated with Washington and limited to missile and air defense sites, was more restrained than many expected and may help diplomatic efforts to return hostages and limit the combat in both Lebanon and Gaza.】

item.title: 汽车贷款裁决后，英国银行将面临数十亿美元的额外赔付
item.description: 伦敦一家法院作出裁决，称贷款机构对汽车贷款客户不够透明，英国银行将面临支付数十亿美元的额外赔偿，这一裁决导致银行股价暴跌。【原文：UK banks are facing paying billions in extra compensation after a London court ruling that said lenders weren’t transparent enough to customers taking out car loans, in a decision that sent bank shares tumbling.】

item.title: 英国同意就其奴隶制遗产与英联邦举行会谈
item.description: 在萨摩亚与其他英联邦国家领导人发表的联合声明中，英国同意就其历史上参与贩卖奴隶的问题举行会谈，但继续排除了进行经济赔偿的可能性。【原文：The UK agreed to hold talks about its historical involvement in the slave trade in a joint statement with other Commonwealth leaders’ in Samoa, but continued to rule out the prospect of financial reparations.】

item.title: 暴风雨 "特拉米 "临近，越南四个机场停飞
item.description: 热带风暴 "特拉米 "已给菲律宾带来死亡和破坏，越南当局正准备暂停中部省份四个机场的运营。【原文：Vietnamese authorities are preparing to suspend operations at four airports in its central provinces as the country braces for Tropical Storm Trami, which already brought death and destruction to the Philippines.】
